page.title: 16LOCAL NEWS SHEFFIELD 1985
page.content:
The{SHEFFIELD STAR}: May 14th.
COME TRY THE DON-BAIT FOR FISHERMEN The dirty{Don}could soon be a perfect spot for Sheffield{anglers.}A report carried out by Sheffield Council has revealed that the River Don is becoming more fishable because perch, roach and trout are apearing in the river. In ten or twenty years we might be able to have some salmon back into the river
The{DARNALL NEWS}: June 1985
KESTRELS NESTING IN DARNALL {Kestrels}have been nesting in Darnall. Three fledging have been reared by their parents and have now left the nest. This is the first report we have heard of them setting up home here.
